head.title: The Crime Rate And Birth Control

hedline.hl1: The Crime Rate And Birth Control

abstract.p: Judith M Kass letter on Franklin Zimring's April 8 Op-Ed article holds additional reasons for drop in crime in New York City are better access to birth control and availability of abortion

block.p: One reason for the drop in crime in the city that Franklin E. Zimring (''Little Changes, Big Results,'' Op-Ed, April 8) doesn't address is twofold: better access to birth control and the availability of abortion.

One reason for the drop in crime in the city that Franklin E. Zimring (''Little Changes, Big Results,'' Op-Ed, April 8) doesn't address is twofold: better access to birth control and the availability of abortion.

In the past, the socioeconomic groups usually most in need of solutions to teenage pregnancy were disenfranchised by reason of education and availability. Today, despite efforts by various groups, we enjoy a culture that shows teenagers how to avoid pregnancy, and provides the means to do it (think subway condoms). A citywide culture that does not condemn abortion comes into play when the parents of the unborn child need it.

Put most plainly, the criminals of tomorrow are being born at lower rates. And when born, have more social services available. If we have to pay higher taxes to pay for these services, it's clear that they pay off and are well worth the cost.
Judith M. Kass Upper West Side
